title: Svitolina's Epic Victory Over Gauff Advances Her to Dubai Final
summary: Ukrainian tennis star Elina Svitolina secured a dramatic victory over world number four Coco Gauff at the Dubai Tennis Championships, winning 6-4, 6-7 (13-15), 6-4 in a match that lasted three hours and three minutes. Despite missing four match points in the second-set tie-break, Svitolina persevered to win the decider, advancing to the final where she will face American Jessica Pegula. Pegula earlier defeated compatriot Amanda Anisimova in a comeback win of 1-6, 6-4, 6-3. This marks Svitolina's return to the Dubai final since her consecutive titles in 2017 and 2018, highlighting her resilience and skill. In related tennis news, world number one Carlos Alcaraz continued his unbeaten streak in 2026 with a win at the Qatar Open, and Venus Williams received a wildcard entry for Indian Wells. The article emphasizes the competitive nature of professional tennis and key player performances.
